intro: Thalictrum hypoleucum, commonly known as the white meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a slender, upright stem and produces numerous stamens, which are a notable feature of its floral structure. Thalictrum hypoleucum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to pollinators.
